title: Designing Hypothetical Learning Trajectories for Comparative Problem-Solving in STEM Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science concepts and mathematical problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Conducting STEM-integrated experiments and digital simulation activities using KoPer media in BYOD environments. Continuously monitoring learning processes through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can formulate and validate hypotheses to solve comparative problems in an integrated STEM environment.
Learners can analyze and interpret experimental data using KoPer media and VR simulations to derive problem-solving strategies.
Learners can correct conceptual errors in the problem-solving process and propose improvements through at least three formative assessments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
